name: places/ChIJNVAXx8NbwokRhE5C05x3dqY
formattedAddress: 44 Church St, New York, NY 10007, USA
adrFormatAddress: 44 Church St, New York, NY 10007, USA

editorialSummary.text: Global chain of counters dispensing sweet & savory soft pretzels with a variety of toppings & dips.

originalText.text:
Since the opening of this location, it had been a breath of fresh and fruitful air. Working in the area and having a new spot to frequent with my coworkers makes work that much easier. Though these feelings have changed after today.

Auntie Anne’s has an app that once you purchase 250 points ($25) worth of products you can redeem those points for one pretzel. Spending 1-2 times a week we ventured into Brookfield mall to buy cinnamon pretzels and we worked together to stack our points to earn that reward. This time, the usually attendant (presumably the owner) proceeded to raise his voice and give us a hard time – accusing us of putting points onto the app without purchasing any items. This draws the attention of other patrons inside the store which led to his publicly shaming of us. We still purchase our pretzel and left. At this point I knew I had to take a photo of the location for this review so when we walked back the owner runs after us yelling, reaches after my phone, and threatens to call the police for taking a photo. Keep in mind this is all happening in the hallway at Brookfield Mall.

I thought the whole purpose of the app was to BUY the item and work up to rewards? We have done exactly as instructed but received such a stale attitude for our loyalty. This is a completely unjust way to act towards anyone.

The joy of coming together to Auntie Anne’s, and what could have been a long-lasting relationship between business and customer, has come to an end. I am told said owner oversees both new Auntie Anne’s locations inside Brookfield Mall. I hope the attitude and treatment towards shoppers changes for these new shops and doesn’t give the mall a bad name.

originalText.text: I ask for a specific cup of  pretzel bites and the server ignored me. Gave me what she wanted and they were dry.

text.text: I ask for a specific cup of  pretzel bites and the server ignored me. Gave me what she wanted and they were dry.

originalText.text: This location has the worst customer service.  I tried to use a gift card a few months back and the person at the register, who seems to be the owner, kept telling me i had a "fake card" because it doesn't scan.  I told him there was a set of instructions on my e-card for him to key in, and he refused, and told me to pay or move aside so he can take the next customer.  This is horrible behavior.  I went to the location at Fulton Center and miraculously, my gift card worked!  Fast forward to today, pretzel day, and i decided to stop here to see if this time, they will let me redeem my free pretzel, since this location was closest to me.  Well, they did-to my surprise! BUT, i asked for a Cinnamon Sugar, and the lady at the register insisted if was- even tho it did not look like it had cinnamon surgar on it.  But, okay, i took it home, and, ummm...this is the most naked cinnamon sugar i have ever had.  i understand it was a free pretzel day pretzel, so i sure hope they are not that skimpy on their toppings on regular days.  Only times i've had poor CS at Auntie Anne's was, sadly, at this location.  Walk a few steps further to Fulton Center ( through the Occulus and hallway, then upstairs) and you will get much better customer service and proper pretzels.  Good thing this one was free!!

originalText.text: I got a coke and a soft pretzel here. It's not great but was definitely what I expected. Unfortunately there's not a good place to eat it. Across from the shop are some uncomfortable "artistic" benches that's the best option.

text.text: I got a coke and a soft pretzel here. It's not great but was definitely what I expected. Unfortunately there's not a good place to eat it. Across from the shop are some uncomfortable "artistic" benches that's the best option.

originalText.text: Trying to redeem points from the app was one of the most frustrating experiences of my life. It felt like the manger went out of his way to make sure the app wouldn’t work. My advice is go to the other franchise location at Fulton station, less than a block away. Great staff there.
